Review with A.I.

Question 1:

Which of the following is NOT a common source of internal financing for a business?

The correct answer is Issuing of new stock.

Here's why:

  • Retained earnings, factoring receivables, and depreciation allowance are all internal sources of financing. They come from the business's own operations and activities, without needing to raise capital from external sources like investors or lenders.
  • Issuing new stock is an external source of financing. When a company issues new stock, it is selling ownership stakes in the business to raise capital. This brings in new money from outside the company, unlike the other options which generate funding from existing resources.

Therefore, the answer to the question is Issuing of new stock because it is the only option that is not an internal source of financing for a business.

I hope this explanation helps! Let me know if you have any other questions.
